meanings.definition: To cut off (a limb), especially by surgery.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to amputate the injured leg to save the patient's life.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon will amputate the arm to prevent the infection from spreading.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I would amputate my hand if it meant I could avoid doing the dishes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to amputate toxic relationships from her life to find happiness.
meanings.sent5: The decision to amputate the tree's branches made it grow stronger and healthier.

meanings.definition: To remove by or as if by cutting.
meanings.sent1: The chef had to amputate the spoiled part of the fruit before using it in the salad.
meanings.sent2: The editor will amputate unnecessary paragraphs from the article to make it more concise.
meanings.sent3: I had to amputate the excess fabric from the dress to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: She decided to amputate negative thoughts from her mind to focus on positivity.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to amputate a section of the painting to improve the overall composition.
